alert.note: Alert for Lyon; Osceola (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Sioux Falls (Southeastern SD, Southwestern MN, and Northwestern IA)
info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued February 21 at 10:27AM CST until February 23 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Sioux Falls
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO NOON CST WEDNESDAY... ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON WEDNESDAY TO NOON CST THURSDAY... * WHAT...For the Blizzard Warning, blizzard conditions expected. For the Winter Weather Advisory, mixed precipitation expected. Total snow accumulations of 8 to 14 inches and ice accumulations of a light glaze. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...In Iowa, Lyon and Osceola Counties. In Minnesota, Nobles and Jackson Counties. * WHEN...For the Blizzard Warning, from noon Wednesday to noon CST Thursday. For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 6 PM this evening to noon CST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Periods of snow are expected through Tuesday into Wednesday morning with increasing winds. During lulls in snowfall tonight and early Wednesday, some patchy freezing drizzle is possible. While areas of blowing snow are possible prior to midday Wednesday, the better potential for more widespread blizzard conditions is expected later Wednesday into Wednesday night.
info.instruction: Travel should be restricted to emergencies only. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you. If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle. Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
